subject: RE: [junit] TestCase() is not public in junit.framework.TestCase
msgSnippet: Have you got a constructor in your TestCase? I ve seen similar errors when I accidentally leave out constructors to subclasses whose parents don t have ()
messageBody:
Have you got a constructor in your TestCase? I've seen similar
errors when I accidentally leave out constructors to subclasses whose
parents don't have () constructors.

Try adding something like this:

public MyTestCase(String text)
{ super(text); }

(replacing MyTestCase with your class name, of course).

Hope this helps,

-tim

p.s. If this doesn't do it, please post your code! (-:

-----Original Message-----
From: mark_farnsworth@...
[mailto:mark_farnsworth@...]
Sent: Wednesday, September 05, 2001 2:29 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] TestCase() is not public in junit.framework.TestCase


Can anyone tell me what is with this error? I'm an old C++ programmer
but a newbie to jUnit and Java. My classpath appears to be correct.
The complete error message reads:
TestCase() is not public in junit.framework.TestCase; cannot be
accessed from outside package

Someone please help. I'm under the gun and losing it...

Many thanks in advance,
Mark
